result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquise Dontae Royster Jr

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Marquise Dontae Royster not in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Status Confeerence.DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Court ordered Bench Warrant Issued. Remand to Commissioner  and No action on bail.

Defendant Marquise Dontae Royster not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
State advises the court the defendant may be in custody. Court orders matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

22RM013369  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
3/9/2022

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.    
Oral No Contact Order with SSR

Defendant Marquise Dontae Royster in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/9/22 @ 1:30p
